title: Event-based solutions for human-centered applications: A comprehensive review
author: Mira Adra (GTD International), Simone Melcarne (Dept. of Digital Security, EURECOM), Nelida Mirabet-Herranz (Dept. of Digital Security, EURECOM), Jean-Luc Dugelay (Dept. of Digital Security, EURECOM), ...
relevance_why: The comprehensive review of event-based vision systems provides insights into novel applications and methodologies that could influence audio-visual integration or generative models in future tasks.
background: This paper reviews the use of event cameras, which capture data based on changes in brightness rather than traditional frame-based methods, focusing on human-centric applications in areas such as facial and body analysis.
contribution: This paper introduces a unified overview of event camera technologies specifically for human-centered applications, highlighting advancements and identifying research gaps.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous surveys focused heavily on either hardware developments or narrow application domains in event-based systems.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work stands out by integrating insights for both facial and body applications and addressing important areas like event data compression and simulation frameworks.

key_innovation: Serves as the first comprehensive reference that unites body and face human-centered applications leveraged by event cameras, pinpointing underexplored areas relevant for future research.
real_world_impact: By bridging insights across distinct human-centric applications, this survey could accelerate the implementation of event cameras in practical scenarios such as security, healthcare, and human-computer interaction.
limitations: The paper does not specify limitations but notes challenges in developing algorithms to effectively process the unique event data.

new_terms.event cameras: **Event cameras** are sensors capable of capturing changes in brightness asynchronously, providing high temporal resolution and low latency compared to conventional cameras.
new_terms.event compression: **Event compression** refers to techniques aimed at reducing the size of event data while preserving essential information, necessary for effective integration into systems requiring real-time processing.

open_sourcing: A summary of the survey can be found at https://github.com/nmirabeth/event_human
